title: The Death of trees: Eucalyptus dieback
brief_description: All over Australia trees are dying for reasons not fully understood. Scientists have termed this phenomenon “dieback”. Within Australia a microscopic fungi and certain insects have been isolated as the cause of the massive destruction of jarrah, New England and eucalypt forests. Scientists are now looking at cloning techniques as a method of breeding trees that are genetically resistant to dieback.
